node.title: Jussie Smollett's Lawyer Says Judge Lunged at Her During Exchange Over Homophobic Slur
node.alt: Tamara Walker, the defense attorney of gay actor Jussie Smollett, accused Cook County Judge James Linn of "physically lunging" at her after Linn asked for a sidebar conversation to question Walker's questioning a prosecution witness about using homophobic language in his previous social media posts. In this photo, Smollett leaves the Leighton Courthouse after his court appearance on March 26, 2019 in Chicago, Illinois.
node.description: Lawyer Tamara Walker accused the presiding judge of "physically lunging" at her and asked for a mistrial. The judge denied her motion.
node.content:
["Tamara Walker, the defense attorney of openly gay actor Jussie Smollett, accused Cook County Judge James Linn of \"physically lunging\" at her after Linn asked for a sidebar conversation to question Walker's questioning a prosecution witness about his use of homophobic language in previous social media posts.", "The trial questions whether Smollett lied to Chicago police in late January 29, 2019 about being victimized in a racist and homophobic attack. Prosecutors allege that Smollett paid $3,500 to two brothers, Abimbola and Olabinjo Osundairo, to stage the attack against him.", "Under cross-examination, Walker asked Olabinjo Osundairo about his past use of homophobic slurs on Twitter. Linn stopped the defense and and \"said they were getting into 'collateral' territory,\" WBBM-TV reported. Walker then asked for a sidebar conversation with Linn.", "When she returned, she accused Linn of \"physically lunging\" at her and asked for a mistrial. Linn denied her motion for a mistrial.", "", "
Tamara Walker, the defense attorney of gay actor Jussie Smollett, accused Cook County Judge James Linn of \"physically lunging\" at her after Linn asked for a sidebar conversation to question Walker's questioning a prosecution witness about using homophobic language in his previous social media posts. In this photo, Smollett leaves the Leighton Courthouse after his court appearance on March 26, 2019 in Chicago, Illinois.
", "This is a breaking news story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
